metadata.title: CVE-2019-11750 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
A type confusion vulnerability exists in Spidermonkey, which results in a non-exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 69 and Firefox ESR < 68.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11750` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2').
